text: The Government Sadiq College Women University (GSCWU) () is a public university located in Bahawalpur, Punjab, Pakistan. ==History== The Government Sadiq College for Women was founded by Nawab Sir Sadiq Khan Abbasi V as an intermediate college in 1944. In 1957, it was upgraded to a degree college. The college was upgraded again, into a post-graduate college in 2010, as Master's programs were instated.https://www.gscwu.edu.pk/index.php?page=3 In December 2012, The Government Sadiq College Women University Bahawalpur act (Act VIII of 2013) was passed by Provincial Assembly of Punjab and assented by Governor of Punjab on 3 January 2013, establishing Sadiq College as a full- fledged university. It is the only female university of Bahawalpur Division, providing female students with standard education.https://www.gscwu.edu.pk/index.php?page=5 ==Programs== GSCWU offers undergraduate and postgraduate programs in following disciplines: *Information Technology *Computer Science *Botany *Zoology *English *Education *Urdu *Economics *Mathematics *Business Administration *Applied Psychology *Home Economics and Fine arts *Chemistry *Physics *Islamic Studies ==See also== * University of Sahiwal * Government College Women University, Faisalabad * Government College Women University, Sialkot * University of Okara * Women University Multan == References == ==External links== * GSCWU official website Category:Public universities and colleges in Punjab, Pakistan Category:1944 establishments in India Category:Educational institutions established in 1944 Category:Universities and colleges in Bahawalpur District Category:Women's universities and colleges in Pakistan
title: Government Sadiq College Women University
